001
002package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node;
003
004import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.StaticContext;
005import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format.IPathFormatter;
006import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format.IPathSegment;
007import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItem;
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItemVisitor;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IResourceLocation;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
011
012import java.net.URI;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.stream.Stream;
016
017import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
018
019import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
020import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
021
022/**
023 * Represents a queryable Metapath model node.
024 */
025public interface INodeItem extends IItem, IPathSegment, INodeItemVisitable {
026
027  /**
028   * Generate a path for this node in the directed node graph, using the provided
029   * path formatter.
030   */
031  @Override
032  String format(IPathFormatter formatter);
033
034  /**
035   * Gets the value of the provided node item.
036   * <p>
037   * If the provided node item is a document, this method get the first child node
038   * item's value, since a document doesn't have a value.
039   *
040   * @param <CLASS>
041   *          the type of the bound object to return
042   * @param item
043   *          the node item to get the value of
044   * @return a bound object
045   * @throws NullPointerException
046   *           if the node item has no associated value
047   */
048  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
049  @NonNull
050  static <CLASS> CLASS toValue(@NonNull INodeItem item) {
051    INodeItem valuedItem;
052    if (item instanceof IDocumentNodeItem) {
053      // get first child item, since the document has no value
054      valuedItem = item.modelItems().findFirst().get();
055    } else {
056      valuedItem = item;
057    }
058    return ObjectUtils.requireNonNull((CLASS) valuedItem.getValue());
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Retrieve the parent node item if it exists.
063   *
064   * @return the parent node item, or {@code null} if this node item has no known
065   *         parent
066   */
067  INodeItem getParentNodeItem();
068
069  /**
070   * Retrieve the parent content node item if it exists. A content node is a
071   * non-document node.
072   *
073   * @return the parent content node item, or {@code null} if this node item has
074   *         no known parent content node item
075   */
076  IModelNodeItem<?, ?> getParentContentNodeItem();
077
078  /**
079   * Get the type of node item this is.
080   *
081   * @return the node item's type
082   */
083  @NonNull
084  NodeItemType getNodeItemType();
085
086  /**
087   * Retrieve the base URI of this node.
088   * <p>
089   * The base URI of a node will be in order of preference:
090   * <ol>
091   * <li>the base URI defined on the node</li>
092   * <li>the base URI defined on the nearest ancestor node</li>
093   * <li>the base URI defined on the document node</li>
094   * <li>{@code null} if the document node is unknown</li>
095   * </ol>
096   *
097   * @return the base URI or {@code null} if it is unknown
098   */
099  URI getBaseUri();
100
101  /**
102   * Get the path for this node item as a Metapath.
103   *
104   * @return the Metapath
105   */
106  @NonNull
107  default String getMetapath() {
108    return toPath(IPathFormatter.METAPATH_PATH_FORMATER);
109  }
110
111  @Override
112  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> getPathStream() {
113    INodeItem parent = getParentNodeItem();
114    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
115        parent == null ? Stream.of(this) : Stream.concat(getParentNodeItem().getPathStream(), Stream.of(this)));
116  }
117
118  /**
119   * Get a stream of all ancestors of this node item. The stream is ordered from
120   * closest to farthest ancestor.
121   *
122   * @return a stream of ancestor node items
123   */
124  @NonNull
125  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> ancestor() {
126    return ancestorsOf(this);
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Get a stream of this and all ancestors of this node item. The stream is
131   * ordered from self, then closest to farthest ancestor.
132   *
133   * @return a stream of this node followed by all ancestor node items
134   */
135  @NonNull
136  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> ancestorOrSelf() {
137    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.concat(Stream.of(this), ancestor()));
138  }
139
140  /**
141   * Get a stream of the ancestors of the provided {@code item}. The stream is
142   * ordered from the closest to farthest ancestor.
143   *
144   * @param item
145   *          the target item to get ancestors for
146   *
147   * @return a stream of all ancestor node items
148   */
149  @NonNull
150  static Stream<? extends INodeItem> ancestorsOf(@NonNull INodeItem item) {
151    INodeItem parent = item.getParentNodeItem();
152    return ObjectUtils.notNull(parent == null ? Stream.empty() : Stream.concat(Stream.of(parent), ancestorsOf(parent)));
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Get a stream of all descendant model items of this node item. The stream is
157   * ordered from closest to farthest descendants in a depth-first order.
158   *
159   * @return a stream of descendant node items
160   */
161  @NonNull
162  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> descendant() {
163    return decendantsOf(this);
164  }
165
166  /**
167   * Get a stream of all descendant model items of the provided {@code item}. The
168   * stream is ordered from closest to farthest descendants in a depth-first
169   * order.
170   *
171   * @param item
172   *          the target item to get descendants for
173   *
174   * @return a stream of descendant node items
175   */
176  @NonNull
177  static Stream<? extends INodeItem> decendantsOf(@NonNull INodeItem item) {
178    Stream<? extends INodeItem> children = item.modelItems();
179
180    return ObjectUtils.notNull(children.flatMap(child -> {
181      assert child != null;
182      return Stream.concat(Stream.of(child), decendantsOf(child));
183    }));
184  }
185
186  /**
187   * Get a stream of this node, followed by all descendant model items of this
188   * node item. The stream is ordered from closest to farthest descendants in a
189   * depth-first order.
190   *
191   * @return a stream of this node and descendant node items
192   */
193  @NonNull
194  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> descendantOrSelf() {
195    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.concat(Stream.of(this), descendant()));
196  }
197
198  /**
199   * Get the flags and value data associated this node. The resulting collection
200   * is expected to be ordered, with the results in document order.
201   * <p>
202   * The resulting collection may be modified, but such modification is not thread
203   * safe
204   *
205   * @return a collection of flags
206   */
207  @NonNull
208  Collection<? extends IFlagNodeItem> getFlags();
209
210  /**
211   * Lookup a flag and value data on this node by it's effective qualified name.
212   *
213   * @param name
214   *          the effective name of the flag
215   * @return the flag with the matching effective name or {@code null} if no match
216   *         was found
217   */
218  @Nullable
219  IFlagNodeItem getFlagByName(@NonNull QName name);
220
221  /**
222   * Get the flags and value data associated with this node as a stream.
223   *
224   * @return the stream of flags or an empty stream if none exist
225   */
226  @SuppressWarnings("null")
227  @NonNull
228  default Stream<? extends IFlagNodeItem> flags() {
229    return getFlags().stream();
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Get the model items (i.e., fields, assemblies) and value data associated this
234   * node. A given model instance can be multi-valued, so the value of each
235   * instance will be a list. The resulting collection is expected to be ordered,
236   * with the results in document order.
237   * <p>
238   * The resulting collection may be modified, but such modification is not thread
239   * safe
240   *
241   * @return a collection of list(s), with each list containing the items for a
242   *         given model instance
243   */
244  @NonNull
245  Collection<? extends List<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>>> getModelItems();
246
247  /**
248   * Get the collection of model items associated with the instance having the
249   * provided {@code name}.
250   * <p>
251   * The resulting collection may be modified, but such modification is not thread
252   * safe
253   *
254   * @param name
255   *          the instance name to get model items for
256   * @return the sequence of items associated with the named model instance, or an
257   *         empty list if an instance with that name is not present
258   */
259  @NonNull
260  List<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> getModelItemsByName(@NonNull QName name);
261
262  /**
263   * Get the model items (i.e., fields, assemblies) and value data associated this
264   * node as a stream.
265   *
266   * @return the stream of model items or an empty stream if none exist
267   */
268  @SuppressWarnings("null")
269  @NonNull
270  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> modelItems() {
271    return getModelItems().stream().flatMap(Collection::stream);
272  }
273
274  /**
275   * Get the resource location information for the node, if known.
276   *
277   * @return the resource location information, or {@code null} if not known
278   */
279  @Nullable
280  IResourceLocation getLocation();
281
282  /**
283   * Get the static context to use to query this node item.
284   *
285   * @return the static context
286   */
287  @NonNull
288  StaticContext getStaticContext();
289
290  @Override
291  default void accept(IItemVisitor visitor) {
292    visitor.visit(this);
293  }
294}
